front.div:
The electrochemcal behavior of Ba^"" on several liquid metal electrodes (Al, Bi, Cd, Pb, Sn
and Zn) in a NaCl-KCl equimolar solvent at 1000 K has been invesUgated by means of cyclic
voltammetry and chronopotentiometry. The kinetic parameters and the diffusion coefficient for
Ba^^ were determined by cyclic voltammetry widi conventional, semi-integral, semi-differential
methods and chronopotentiometry. It was revealed diat on a liquid Pb electrode in the NaCl-
KCl system at 1000 K the quasi-reversible cathodic reaction Ba^"" + 2e~ + Pb BaPb takes
place. In addition, the kinetic parameters and die diffusion coefficient agree well widi die values
determined by various electroanalyses. The possibility of alloy formation between Ba and Sn was
also demonsUated in this paper.
